dtliExcerpt: Cole Escola's unhinged comedy about Mary Todd Lincoln is a hilarious exercise in theatrical anarchy that manages to be both completely ridiculous and surprisingly touching.

wrongAttributionNote: Adam Feldman writes for Time Out New York (timeout.com), not TheaterMania. Proper review exists at correct outlet. URL was fabricated (shared article ID). Source: web-search bulk import.
nycTheatreExcerpt: The show is even better in its uptown transfer, with bigger physical performances and punchier deliveries of the hilarious lines in Escola's script. Laughs are rarely more than a few seconds apart. It is, without a doubt, the funniest comedy on Broadway right now.
